column5: Hey guys, my annual trip to lac seul is july 9-16. Anyone have any news from recent trips (weather, bite, etc..) Any news is great news!!! Very excited and can't wait to get back up there and fishing! Thanks Kurt
kurt,Where you gonna be fishin' at on LS? I will be there on the same dates.

We got back last Friday from Lac Seul Outposts. Four guys-four days-800 walleyes. The biggest was 26". Three of four days were decent weather. We're going back in July with our wives. A sneaky way to get in two trips a year. Good luck!!!

JS- we usually fish the upper northeast portion of the lake. we go out through lac seul floating lodges. what about you? Pacman- glad to hear it was a good trip and you are very lucky to get that second trip! I could only wish for two trips

Kurt,We will be going with Sioux Lookout Floating Lodges. Fishing up the east/northeast side. Can't wait, great place. hoping for some warmer weather up there then what it has been. if we get some consistent weather i don't see why it won't be great fishing. This will be my 8th year there, not all on a houseboat however. good luck. by the sounds of it the water is rising some and the houseboats are going through the "RAGS".
ill be there the same week. usually the weather is stabilized by then. thats always the key to fishing there. weather weather weather. whit
were staying with rob eady at cherob resort in goose bay. cant wait.
JS- this will be my 9th year, all of which on the house boat and the same area! cant wait to be up there and hammering them again!

I am the lucky guy who takes his wife on a 2nd Lac Seul trip in July with Pacman and his wife. We find the fish in the same spots as June except maybe a little deeper and use jigs with crawlers or minnows. The wives seem to always catch the biggest fish ranging from 26-28 inches. If you have a wife that likes to fish walleyes, there is no better place than Lac Seul.
